en.purpose: To record the blood group and rhesus status of an individual.
en.use:
Use to record the blood group and rhesus status of an individual.

As the blood group and rhesus status of an individual is usually stable over the life of an individual, this archetype has been modelled as an EVALUATION.
en.misuse: Not to be used to record the result of blood group and antigen test results which may need to be performed at various times over an individual's life - for example, to confirm their blood group and antigen status prior to transfusion, organ transplantation, in pregnancy and investigating certain neonatal conditions. Use the CLUSTER.laboratory_test_analyte nested within the OBSERVATION.laboratory_test_result archetype to record the result of each individual test.

nb.purpose: For Ã¥ registrere detaljer om den fÃ¸rste dagen i den siste menstruasjonsperioden individet opplevde.
keywords: menstruasjon, mensen, LNMP, LMP, LNP, DLMP
nb.use:
Brukes for Ã¥ registrere detaljer om den fÃ¸rste dagen i den siste menstruasjonsperioden individet opplevde.

Bruk dataelementet "Sikkerhet" for Ã¥ registrere sikkerhetsgraden for at datoen var korrekt. Ved registrering av startdatoen for siste menstruasjonsperiode er antagelsen at denne menstruasjonen var normal.
nb.misuse:
Brukes ikke for Ã¥ registrere detaljer om menarke eller overgangsalder - bruk arketypen EVALUATION.menstruation_summary for dette formÃ¥let.

Brukes ikke for Ã¥ registrere informasjon om en spesifikk dag i menstruasjonssyklusen, bruk arketypen OBSERVATION.menstrual_diary for dette formÃ¥let.

Brukes ikke for Ã¥ registrere informasjon om typiske eller vanlige menstruasjonssykluser eller mÃ¸nstre - bruk arketypen EVALUATION.menstruation_summary for dette formÃ¥let.

en.purpose: To record the details about the first day of the most recent menstrual cycle for the individual.
keywords: menstruation, menses, LNMP, LMP, LNP, DLMP
en.use:
Use to record the details about the first day of the most recent menstrual cycle for the individual. 

Use the data element 'Certainty' to record the level of certainty the date was correct. The assumption when recording the onset of the last menstrual cycle is that the menstruation was 'normal'.
en.misuse:
Not to be used to record information about menses or related symptoms, use the OBSERVATION.menstruation archetype for this purpose. 

Not to be used to record information about a specific day in a menstrual cycle, use the OBSERVATION.menstrual_diary archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record information about an individual's menstruation history events or patterns of menstruation over time, use the EVALUATION.menstruation_summary archetype for this purpose.

at0002.1.description: Date of onset of menstrual bleeding.
at0002.1.comment:
Also known as 'LMP'. Useful to persist for calculations including estimated date of delivery in pregnancy, or to distinguish the latest typical menstrual cycle when there is an irregular menstrual pattern.
Can be a partial date, for example, only a year.

author.name: Marit Alice Venheim, John Tore Valand

at0000.1.text: Last menstrual period corrected by ecography
at0000.1.description: Identification of the first day of the most recent menstrual cycle for the individual.

at0002.1.text: Date last menstrual period corrected by ecography
at0002.1.description: Date of onset of menstrual bleeding.

Also known as 'LMP'. Useful to persist for calculations including estimated date of delivery in pregnancy, or to distinguish the latest typical menstrual cycle when there is an irregular menstrual pattern.

en.purpose: To record estimated due dated for a pregnancy, calculated or estimated by a variety of methods.
en.use:
Use to record one or more estimated date of delivery (EDD), calculated or estimated by a variety of methods during the span of a single pregnancy. 

The agreed EDD is used as the basis for management of the pregnancy.

at0004.1.description: The EDD estimated from an LNMP and characteristics of the menstrual cycle.
at0004.1.comment: The details about the menstrual cycle will be recorded elsewhere in the health record, usually captured using the OBSERVATION.menstruation archetype.

en.purpose: To record the estimated or known gestation age of a current pregnancy or new born at a point in time.
en.use: To record the estimated or known gestational age of a pregnancy or new born.
en.misuse: Not to record the gestational of the foetus at birth. This is recorded in the pregnancy summary.

at0000.1.text: Gestational age according to last menstrual period date
at0000.1.description: The estimate or known period or duration of the pregnancy or gestational age of the foetus or new born.

en.purpose: To record the estimated or known gestation age of a current pregnancy or new born at a point in time.
en.use: To record the estimated or known gestational age of a pregnancy or new born.
en.misuse: Not to record the gestational of the foetus at birth. This is recorded in the pregnancy summary.

at0000.1.description: The estimate or known period or duration of the pregnancy or gestational age of the foetus or new born.

pt.purpose: *To record summary or persistent information about the numbers of key obstetric events that may impact risk assessment or decision support.(en)
pt.use:
*Use to record summary or persistent information about the numbers of key obstetric events that may impact risk assessment or decision support.

Data recorded using this archetype is intended to be revised and updated after each pregnancy, either manually by a clinician or automatically calculated within a clinical system. It is anticipated that this archetype represents only one component of an obstetric history. A complete obstetric history should be represented using multiple archetypes within a template.

In order to record a TPAL overview, Term Births (T), Preterm Births (P) and Abortions (A) can be recorded using this archetype. Living Children (L) can be recorded using the EVALUATION.social_network archetype, so that it can be used more broadly. Some variants may also use Gravidity (G) and the number of Multiple Births (M). 

In many jurisdictions, the definition of some of these data elements may vary. For this reason, definitions may be included in the Protocol to ensure clarity of intent especially if the data is being exchanged between jurisdictions.(en)
pt.misuse:
*Not for recording summary information about a single pregnancy. Use specific archetypes for this purpose.

Not to be used to record details about procedures performed during a pregnancy, for example terminations or deliveries. Use the ACTION.procedure archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record the details about findings in each antenatal visits or during labour. Detailed data should be recorded using appropriate archetypes for this purpose such as OBSERVATION.story together with CLUSTER.symptom_sign; OBSERVATION.blood pressure; OBSERVATION.urinalysis; or EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis.(en)

nb.purpose: For Ã¥ registrere sammendrag eller vedvarende informasjon om antall sentrale obstetriske hendelser som kan pÃ¥virke risikovurdering eller beslutningsstÃ¸tte.
nb.use:
Brukes for Ã¥ registrere sammendrag eller vedvarende informasjon om antall sentrale obstetriske hendelser som kan pÃ¥virke risikovurdering eller beslutningsstÃ¸tte.

Intensjonen med denne arketypen er at den skal gjennomgÃ¥s og oppdateres etter hvert svangerskap, enten manuelt av helsepersonell eller automatisk oppdatert i et klinisk system. Det er antatt at denne arketypen kun representerer en komponent av en obstetrisk historie. Ved Ã¥ bruke flere arketyper inn i en templat vil det oppnÃ¥s en komplett obstetrisk historie. 

For Ã¥ registrere en TPAL oversikt kan denne arketypen brukes til Ã¥ registrere FÃ¸dsler til termin (T), Premature fÃ¸dsler (P), Aborter (A). For Ã¥ registrere Levende barn (L) benyttes arketypen EVALUATION.social_network. Noen varianter bruker ogsÃ¥ Gravida (G) og antall FlerlingefÃ¸dsler (M).

Definisjonen for noen av disse dataelementene vil variere mellom myndighetsomrÃ¥der, det er derfor mulig Ã¥ legge til definisjonen i Protocol-delen av arketypen. Dette er viktig dersom utveksling av data forekommer mellom myndighetsomrÃ¥der.
nb.misuse:
Brukes ikke for Ã¥ dokumentere informasjon om ett enkelt svangerskap. Bruk spesifikke arketyper for dette formÃ¥let.

Brukes ikke for Ã¥ dokumentere detaljer rundt et inngrep i svangerskapet, for eksempel svangerskapsavbrudd eller forlÃ¸sning. Bruk arketypen ACTION.procedure (Prosedyre) for dette formÃ¥let.

Brukes ikke for Ã¥ registrere detaljer om funn under hver enkelt svangerskapskontroll eller under fÃ¸dsel. Dette registreres i egne arketyper for dette formÃ¥let som for eksempel: OBSERVATION.story (Anamnese) sammen med CLUSTER.symptom_sign (Symptom/sykdomstegn), OBSERVATION.blood_pressure (Blodtrykk), OBSERVATION.urinalysis (Urinanalyse) eller EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis (Problem/diagnose).

pt-br.use:

Utilizar, se adequado, como a base de relatÃ³rios legais sobre nascimentos.

en.purpose: To record summary or persistent information about the numbers of key obstetric events that may impact risk assessment or decision support.
en.use:
Use to record summary or persistent information about the numbers of key obstetric events that may impact risk assessment or decision support.

Data recorded using this archetype is intended to be revised and updated after each pregnancy, either manually by a clinician or automatically calculated within a clinical system. It is anticipated that this archetype represents only one component of an obstetric history. A complete obstetric history should be represented using multiple archetypes within a template.

In order to record a TPAL overview, Term Births (T), Preterm Births (P) and Abortions (A) can be recorded using this archetype. Living Children (L) can be recorded using the EVALUATION.social_network archetype, so that it can be used more broadly. Some variants may also use Gravidity (G) and the number of Multiple Births (M). 

In many jurisdictions, the definition of some of these data elements may vary. For this reason, definitions may be included in the Protocol to ensure clarity of intent especially if the data is being exchanged between jurisdictions.
en.misuse:
Not for recording summary information about a single pregnancy. Use specific archetypes for this purpose.

Not to be used to record details about procedures performed during a pregnancy, for example terminations or deliveries. Use the ACTION.procedure archetype for this purpose.

Not to be used to record the details about findings in each antenatal visits or during labour. Detailed data should be recorded using appropriate archetypes for this purpose such as OBSERVATION.story together with CLUSTER.symptom_sign; OBSERVATION.blood pressure; OBSERVATION.urinalysis; or EVALUATION.problem_diagnosis.

es-co.purpose: Sirve para registrar una visiÃ³n general sobre la historia obstÃ©trica de una mujer con fines de: proporcionar un resumen de su historia obstÃ©trica, la presentaciÃ³n de informes a los Ã³rganos estatutarios o el apoyo de soporte de decisiones clÃ­nicas
es-co.use:
Sirve para registrar una visiÃ³n general sobre la historia obstÃ©trica de una mujer, incluyendo un resumen de todos los embarazos.

Utilice este resmen como base para informes legales con respecto a los nacimientos .

Se utiliza para registrar la informaciÃ³n general de una historia obstÃ©trica, si es necesario - el nÃºmero de nacimientos a termino (T) , los nacimientos prematuros (P) , Abortos (A) y niÃ±os que viven (L) . Algunas variaciones aÃ±aden Gravidez (G) y el nÃºmero de nacimientos mÃºltiples (M) .

Algunos datos pueden ser calculados o derivados de los registros individuales de embarazo, si estÃ¡n disponibles.
es-co.misuse:
No es para registrar la informaciÃ³n del embarazo actual - utilice el arquetipo EVALUACIÃN. pregnancy_summary para este propÃ³sito.

No es para registrar la informaciÃ³n detallada sobre cada uno de los individuales embarazos, abortos involuntarios , Embarazos interrumpidos, o nacimientos. Esta informaciÃ³n se registra utilizando otros arquetipos especÃ­ficos como datos basados ââen eventos .

de.purpose:
Zur Darstellung bekannter Risikofaktoren fÃ¼r eine identifizierte Krankheit, einen Zustand oder ein anderes potenziell gesundheitsschÃ¤dliches Problem und / oder einer Beurteilung der Wahrscheinlichkeit, dass die Person in der Zukunft davon betroffen ist.

Dieser Archetyp wurde absichtlich offen und breit angelegt. Das "Gesundheitsrisiko" kann aus den Risikofaktoren aus dem einen oder allen den folgenden Bereichen ermittelt werden: medizinische Risikofaktoren, Biomarker, Lebensstil, soziale Risikofaktoren, Berufsrisiko oder Umweltbereich.
Die Absicht dieses Archetyps besteht darin, potentielle Risiken zu einem bestimmten Zeitpunkt zu dokumentieren und Entscheidungen zu unterstÃ¼tzen, die das erkannte Risiko verringern kÃ¶nnen, sei es durch Kliniker oder die Person selbst.
de.use:
Der Archetyp "Bewertung des Gesundheitsrisikos" wird verwendet, um bekannte Risikofaktoren fÃ¼r eine identifizierte Krankheit, einen Zustand oder ein anderes potenziell gesundheitsschÃ¤dliches Problem darzustellenn und / oder zur Bewertung der Wahrscheinlichkeit, dass die Person in Zukunft davon betroffen ist.

Da Risikofaktoren im Laufe der Zeit schrittweise identifiziert werden und das Gesamtrisiko infolgedessen neu bewertet wird, wird der "Identifizierungszeitpunkt" das Datum erfassen, an dem der Risikofaktor identifiziert wurde. Das Datenelement "Letzte Aktualisierung" gibt an, wann die gesamte Bewertung zuletzt aktualisiert wurde.

fi.purpose:
*To record known risk factors for an identified disease, condition, or other potentially adverse health issue, and/or an evaluation of the likelihood of the individual experiencing it in the future.

This archetype has been deliberately left open and broad in scope. The 'Health Risk' could be determined from risk factors from any or all of: medical; biomarker; lifestyle; social; occupational hazard; or environmental domains.

The intent of this archetype is to document potential risk at a point in time, and to support decision-making that may reduce the identified risk, whether by clinicians or the individual themselves.(en)
fi.use:
*Use to record known risk factors for an identified disease, condition, or other potentially adverse health issue, and/or an evaluation of the likelihood of the individual experiencing it in the future.

As risk factors may be gradually identified over time and the overall risk reassessed as a result, the 'Date identified' will record the date on which each risk factor has been identified and the 'Last updated' data element will record the last time that the whole assessment was updated.(en)

sv.purpose:
Att registrera kÃ¤nda riskfaktorer fÃ¶r en identifierad sjukdom, tillstÃ¥nd eller annat potentiellt skadligt hÃ¤lsotillstÃ¥nd, och / eller en utvÃ¤rdering av sannolikheten fÃ¶r att personen upplever det i framtiden.

Denna arketyp har medvetet lÃ¤mnats Ã¶ppen och omfattande. Risken kan bestÃ¤mmas av riskfaktorer frÃ¥n nÃ¥gon eller alla fÃ¶ljande domÃ¤ner: medicinska; biomarkÃ¶r; livsstil; social; yrkesrisk; eller miljÃ¶domÃ¤ner.

Avsikten med denna arketyp Ã¤r att dokumentera potentiell risk vid en tidpunkt och att stÃ¶dja beslutsfattande som kan minska den identifierade risken, vare sig av kliniker eller individen sjÃ¤lva.
sv.use:
AnvÃ¤nds fÃ¶r att registrera kÃ¤nda riskfaktorer fÃ¶r en identifierad sjukdom, tillstÃ¥nd eller annat potentiellt skadligt hÃ¤lsotillstÃ¥nd, och / eller en utvÃ¤rdering av sannolikheten fÃ¶r att personen drabbas av det i framtiden.

Eftersom riskfaktorer kan identifieras gradvis Ã¶ver tiden och den Ã¶vergripande risken omvÃ¤rderas som ett resultat kommer den "identifierade Datum" att registrera det datum dÃ¥ varje riskfaktor har identifierats och "Senast uppdaterad" dataelement registrerar sista gÃ¥ngen att hela utvÃ¤rderingen uppdaterades.

nb.purpose:
Brukes til Ã¥ registrere kjente risikofaktorer for en spesifikk sykdom, tilstand eller andre potensielt uÃ¸nskede helseproblemer. Det kan ogsÃ¥ registreres en vurdering av sannsynligheten for at individet vil oppleve den aktuelle tilstanden i fremtiden.

Arketypen er med vilje laget Ã¥pen og bred. Helserisikoen kan bestemmes ut fra risikofaktorer fra det medisinske feltet, biomarkÃ¸rer, livsstil, sosiale forhold, yrkesmessige farer eller omgivelser.

Intensjonen med arketypen er Ã¥ dokumentere en potensiell risiko ved et gitt tidspunkt, og Ã¥ stÃ¸tte beslutninger som kan redusere risikoen enten de er tatt av en kliniker eller av individet selv.
nb.use:
Brukes til Ã¥ registrere kjente risikofaktorer for en spesifikk sykdom, tilstand eller andre potensielt uÃ¸nskede helseproblemer. Det kan ogsÃ¥ registreres en vurdering av sannsynligheten for at individet vil oppleve den aktuelle tilstanden i fremtiden.

Siden risikofaktorer gradvis kan identifiseres over tid og den generelle risikoen revurderes som et resultat, vil 'Dato identifisert' registrere datoen hvor hver risikofaktor er identifisert og dataelementet 'Sist oppdatert' registrerer siste gang hele vurderingen ble oppdatert.

es-ar.purpose:
Para el registro de factores de riesgo para una enfermedad, condiciÃ³n u otro problema potencialmente adverso para la salud, y/o para la evaluaciÃ³n de la probabilidad de que el individuo experimente estas situaciones en el futuro.
Este arquetipo se mantiene deliberadamente abierto y amplio en su alcance. El 'Riesgo para la Salud' puede ser determinado a partir de todos o algunos de los factores de riesgo: mÃ©dicos, marcadores biolÃ³gicos, estilo de vidas, sociales, riesgo ocupacional o cuestiones ambientales.
El propÃ³sito de este arquetipo es la documentaciÃ³n de un riesgo potencial en un punto en el tiempo, y para asistir en la toma de decisiones que puedan reducir el mencionado riesgo, ya sea por parte de los mÃ©dicos o del/de los individuo/s mismo/s.
es-ar.use:
*Use to record known risk factors for an identified disease, condition, or other potentially adverse health issue, and/or an evaluation of the likelihood of the individual experiencing it in the future.

As risk factors may be gradually identified over time and the overall risk reassessed as a result, the 'Date identified' will record the date on which each risk factor has been identified and the 'Last updated' data element will record the last time that the whole assessment was updated.(en)

en.purpose:
To record known risk factors for an identified disease, condition, or other potentially adverse health issue, and/or an evaluation of the likelihood of the individual experiencing it in the future.

This archetype has been deliberately left open and broad in scope. The 'Health Risk' could be determined from risk factors from any or all of: medical; biomarker; lifestyle; social; occupational hazard; or environmental domains.

The intent of this archetype is to document potential risk at a point in time, and to support decision-making that may reduce the identified risk, whether by clinicians or the individual themselves.
en.use:
Use to record known risk factors for an identified disease, condition, or other potentially adverse health issue, and/or an evaluation of the likelihood of the individual experiencing it in the future.

As risk factors may be gradually identified over time and the overall risk reassessed as a result, the 'Date identified' will record the date on which each risk factor has been identified and the 'Last updated' data element will record the last time that the whole assessment was updated.

it.purpose:
Registrare i fattori di rischio noti per una malattia, una condizione o un altro problema di salute potenzialmente avverso e/o una valutazione della probabilitÃ  che l'individuo ne sia colpito in futuro.

Questo archetipo Ã¨ stato deliberatamente lasciato aperto e di ampio respiro. Il "rischio per la salute" potrebbe essere determinato dai fattori di rischio di uno o di tutti i settori: medico, biomarcatore, stile di vita, sociale, rischio professionale o ambientale.

L'intento di questo archetipo Ã¨ quello di documentare il rischio potenziale in un determinato momento e di supportare il processo decisionale che puÃ² ridurre il rischio identificato, sia da parte dei medici che dell'individuo stesso.
it.use:
Utilizzare per registrare i fattori di rischio noti per una malattia, condizione o altro problema di salute potenzialmente avverso identificato, e/o una valutazione della probabilitÃ  che l'individuo ne sia colpito in futuro.

PoichÃ© i fattori di rischio possono essere identificati gradualmente nel tempo e il rischio complessivo puÃ² essere rivalutato di conseguenza, la "Data identificata" registrerÃ  la data in cui ciascun fattore di rischio Ã¨ stato identificato e l'elemento di dati "Ultimo aggiornamento" registrerÃ  l'ultima volta che l'intera valutazione Ã¨ stata aggiornata.

at0002.1.description: Identification of the potential future disease, condition or health issue for which the risk is being assessed, by name.
at0002.1.comment: Coding of 'Health risk' with a terminology is preferred, where possible. Free text should be used only if there is no appropriate terminology available. For example: risk of cardiovascular disease, with risk factors of hypertension and hypercholesterolaemia.
